“You’ve just seen him. What did you think?”  
“Surely that’s not all you’re building on?”  
“Not just that. He confessed to Sofya. He’s a murderer.”  
Dounia gasped. “It cannot be. There was no cause. It’s a lie!”  
“He killed an old pawnbroker and her sister. He robbed them.”  
Dounia stood, trembling. “How could he steal? Can he be a thief?”  
She implored Svidrigaïlov, fear forgotten.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia is horrified to learn that a man she knows has confessed to murdering a pawnbroker and her sister for robbery.
